intro: Tetrazygiopsis hispida, commonly known as the hispid tetrazygiopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers full sun to partial shade.
